title: [Question] is there a shuttle bus service provided by EC campus to metro station
content: I saw there is a bus service for RR campus students for their nearest metro station, so I thought whether its available in ec campus

comments.body: r they willing to create one, ik yellow line opened recently, wt is the management saying about it,
my home is already too far, the walking upto college will eat up so much time of mine
The metro station is right outside the campus tho, would honestly take longer in bus than by walk

They may but it's not even logical.
If they were to pick up, they would pick up near the gate, which itself is a 8 mins walk from BE block.
Then from the gate, the metro is a 7 mins walk. You can't take a U-turn in the service road with so much traffic, unless they use some small bus or that golf kart they have lol.
You can say I'm frustrated just as much , but it's better to just accept a 15 mins walk daily to and fro, gives mental peace.

doreswamy sir grilled us about this during orientation saying stuff like how we can't walk this much distance and stuff


so i don't think they will add a shuttle for ec campus
its not right outside bruh, nearly 1 km walk upto engineering block
nigga would come by car once in a year, says we can't walk daily

I doubt? Took the metro for the first and last time during my grad on Sunday and the metro bridge is just a short walk from the gate. Besides this, the driver would have to drive until Hosa Road to take a U-Turn and reach campus after dropping y'all. Back in 2021, Jawahar told us in our orientation that we would need to walk everywhere within campus and I doubt bro has changed his views four years later lmao. The golf kart dude has explicity been told not to transport students anywhere, I twisted my ankle once in my third year and I had to have an almost 10 minute talk with him that "just because you can't see my injury doesn't mean it doesn't exist" lmao. Maybe if a lot if you request, they might oblige but if they haven't provided a bus to the Konappana Agrahara bus stand, I don't see them providing a shuttle service to the metro, which is a shame because those roads are dangerous and the NICE Road exit is also there.

RR Campus is a whole different story. Both Mysore Road and Pantarapalya Nayanadahalli metro stations are 2km away and its a common bus route.
yea dude, its really hard sometimes to cross tht nice road ext

The answer to this is: No (Until a serious issue happens)
